issues.title: Metadata Contract Change Without Consumer Analysis
issues.description: The PR removes parent_id from metadata dict. While the column never existed in SQLite (so fix is correct), this is a contract change for any code expecting that field.
issues.recommendation: Add inline comment explaining parent_id omission; verify no frontend components use this field

issues.title: Test Coverage Validates Mocks, Not Real Schema
issues.description: Tests in test_research.py mock database connections rather than validating against actual SQLite schema. This is why the original bug wasn't caught by tests.
issues.recommendation: Consider adding integration test with actual SQLite fixture to prevent schema drift bugs

issues.title: Semantic Information Loss Assessment
issues.description: Removing parent_id loses hierarchical context about page location in Coda document structure. However, this data was never actually persisted to the SQLite schema, so no actual regression.
issues.recommendation: Evaluate if parent hierarchy should be added to schema in future (file new issue if valuable)

output_quality_impact.notes: No degradation - fix restores broken functionality

missed_updates.notes: No downstream consumers found for removed field

regression_risks.notes: Tests use mocks, don't validate actual schema

summary: The PR correctly fixes a SQL column mismatch that was preventing the coda_page adapter from functioning. The root cause analysis is sound - the SQLite schema uses 'title' not 'name', and doesn't have a 'parent_id' column. All issues are non-blocking observations for future improvement.
